text: The Palestinian Mujahideen Movement ) is one of the most prominent Islamic armed resistance factions in the Occupied Palestinian Territory. Carl S. Ehrlich "Philistines" The Oxford Guide to People and Places of the Bible. Ed. Bruce M. Metzger and Michael D. Coogan. Oxford University Press, 2001. The Palestinian Mujahideen Movement was founded in 2001 as military groups known as the Mujahideen Battalion, led by founder Omar Abu Sharia, at the beginning of the Second Palestinian Uprising (also known as the Al-Aqsa Intifada). They broke away from the Fatah movement the along with their military wing, the Mujahideen Brigades. The Mujahideen Brigades () were known as the the Martyr Jamal Al-Amari Brigade when they were part of Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades, Their current Secretary General (as of 2023) is Asaad Abu Sharia (أسعد أبو شريعة). https://nabd.com/t/134098586-ece2a5 == Other websites == * The Party's official website (in Arabic) == Notes == == References == Category:Hamas allies Category:Palestinian political violence Category:National liberation movements Category:Palestinian Joint Operations Room Category:Fatah breakaway groups Category:Political parties in Palestine Category:Jihadist groups
title: Palestinian Mujahideen Movement
